section.heading: Additional standards for providers of temporary shelter, transitional housing, and permanent housing programs.
section.text: In addition to the requirements in §§ 4-754.21, 4-754.22, and 4-754.23, providers of temporary shelter, transitional housing, and permanent housing programs shall provide:

para.text: Assessment by an appropriately trained, qualified, and supervised case manager in order to identify each client’s service needs;
Direct provision of, or referral to, appropriate supportive services to enable the client to fulfill the goals and requirements in the client’s service plan;

Mail and phone services, or procedures for handling mail and phone messages, that enable the client to receive mail and messages without identifying the client as residing in temporary shelter, transitional housing, or permanent housing program facility when all of the units are in one location;
Private, secure space for the temporary storage of personal belongings;
Access to laundry facilities in the immediate vicinity of the temporary shelter, transitional housing, or permanent housing program facility when all of the units are in one location;
Reasonable access to phones during reasonable hours and during emergencies;
The opportunity to establish a voluntary savings or escrow account; and

In temporary shelters, transitional housing, and permanent housing programs for families, access to immediate indoor or outdoor areas equipped with basic facilities for exercise and play for use by minor children.
